arm_group.description: 4mg nicotine lozenge administered orally as a single dose treatment per subject
4mg nicotine lozenge administered orally as a single dose treatment per subject
4mg nicotine lozenge administered orally as a single dose treatment per subject
4mg nicotine lozenge (internationally marketed) to be administered orally as a single dose treatment  per subject.

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a randomized, single center, open label, single dose, four way crossover study in
      fasted healthy male subjects to compare the pharmacokinetics of nicotine following
      administration of 3 prototype 4mg nicotine lozenge to an internationally marketed 4mg
      nicotine lozenge. Blood samples will be drawn at pre-specified intervals for a total of 12
      hours post dose in each treatment session and plasma samples analyzed for nicotine levels.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetic Study of 4 mg Nicotine Lozenge.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        - smoked commercially-manufactured cigarettes daily for the preceding 12 months and
        routinely smokes first cigarette within 30mins of awakening.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  inability to refrain from smoking during confinement period, smoking tobacco in any
             other form other than commercially manufactured cigarettes, subject has used chewing
             tobacco or other tobacco products other than commercially manufactured cigarettes
             within 7 days of dosing

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Cross-Over, Single Dose Pharmacokinetic Study of 4mg Nicotine Lozenges.

oversight_info.authority: India: Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI)

primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time curve from zero and extrapolated to the time of last quantifiable sample was determined from plasma concentration time profile of nicotine. AUC(0 -t) was based on the baseline adjusted nicotine plasma concentration data.
primary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve from time 0 to t, AUC (0-t)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected pre-dose and at 5, 10, 15, 30 and 45 minutes and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10 and 12 hours post dosing

primary_outcome.description: Maximum plasma nicotine concentration was determined from plasma-concentration time profiles. Cmax was based on the baseline adjusted nicotine plasma concentration data.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected pre-dose and at 5, 10, 15, 30 and 45 minutes and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10 and 12 hours post dosing

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma nicotine concentration-time curve from zero extrapolated to infinity was determined. AUC(0-inf) was based on the baseline adjusted nicotine plasma concentration data.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected pre-dose and at 5, 10, 15, 30 and 45 minutes and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10 and 12 hours post dosing

secondary_outcome.description: Tmax was determined from plasma concentration time profiles. Tmax was based on the baseline adjusted nicotine plasma concentration data.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected pre-dose and at 5, 10, 15, 30 and 45 minutes and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10 and 12 hours post dosing

secondary_outcome.description: Elimination rate constant for nicotine was calculated. Kel was based on the baseline adjusted nicotine plasma concentration data.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected pre-dose at 5, 10, 15, 30 and 45 minutes and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10 and 12 hours post dosing

secondary_outcome.description: Half-life of elimination of nicotine was determined. t1/2 was based on the baseline adjusted nicotine plasma concentration data.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were collected pre-dose and at 5, 10, 15, 30 and 45 minutes and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10 and 12 hours post dosing

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
